Audio Description: Purchasing war bonds for Christmas is the subject of this World War II poster. The poster is an illustration of the Magi following the Star of Bethlehem. The three wise men are riding camels at night. The three kings wear traditional Arab garb, with robes and hats of head- pieces of many colors, such as red, yellow, purple, white and blue. The king on the right camel has a long white beard, the king in the middle has a brown beard and the king on the left has brown skin. The brown camels are also decoratively arrayed with colorful saddles and bridles of red and gold.   At the top portion of the poster is a dark blue starry sky. On the right side of the poster in the distance is a white star with radiating streaks of light. At the top of the poster in lighter blue letters are the words “For Peace and Security;” and at the bottom of the poster on a dull maroon background in white letters is the message “Buy Bonds.”
Creator: United States. Treasury Department. War Finance Division
Description: Poster, 46.9 x 65.8 cm, artist: Linn Ball

Title: For peace and security: buy bonds
